evidence.text:
107 | 2021-06-01 | Joint MOTION to Stay by United States of America. (Attachments: # 1 Text of Proposed Order)(MacWilliams, Philip) (Entered: 06/01/2021)
108 | 2021-06-01 | ORDER granting 107 Motion to Stay. This action is to be held in abeyance for an additional period of sixty (60) days, until August 2, 2021, at which time the parties will advise the Court whether an additional abeyance is sought or, if not, all existing deadlines will be extended by an additional sixty (60) days, for a total of one-hundred four (104) days from existing deadlines. Signed by Senior Judge Susan R Bolton on 6/1/21. (MAW) (Entered: 06/

111 | 2021-08-03 | ORDER granting 110 Motion to Stay for an additional period of sixty (60) days, until October 1, 2021, at which time the parties will advise the Court whether an additional abeyance is sought or, if not, all existing deadlines will be extended by an additional sixty (60) days, for a total of one hundred sixty-four (164

113 | 2021-09-30 | ORDER granting 112 Motion to Stay. This action is to be held in abeyance for an additional period of sixty (60) days, until November 30, 2021, at which time the parties will advise the Court whether an additional abeyance is sought or, if not, all existing deadlines will be extended by an additional sixty (60) days, for a total of two hundred twenty-four (224) days from existing deadlines. Signed by Senior Judge Susan R Bolton on 9/30/21. (MAW) (Entered: 09/30/2021)

12-21 | ORDER granting 117 Motion to Lift Stay. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED setting a status conference on January 27, 2022 at 10:30 a.m. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that out of state counsel may appear telephonically. Counsel are directed to call (866) 390-1828; Access code: 9667260 five minutes prior to the hearing. Signed by Senior Judge Susan R Bolton on 12/21/21. (MAW) (Entered: 12/21/2021)

extracted.value: Granted motion to lift stay (117) on 2021-12-21.
